title: LaunchDarkly Integrations Manifest
description: Describes the capabilities and intent of a LaunchDarkly integration

version.title: Version
version.description: A semantic version of the integration. See https://semver.org for more info.

overview.title: Short description
overview.description: A short-one liner describing your integration

description.title: Long description
description.description: A longer description of your integration

details.title: Learn more details
details.description: Details about your integration and next steps if the installation happens outside of LaunchDarkly

author.title: Author
author.description: Name of the author or organization responsible for the integration

supportEmail.title: Support Email
supportEmail.description: Email address for your integration's support

links.title: Links
links.description: A set of reference links supporting your integration

launchdarklyDocs.title: LaunchDarkly Documentation
launchdarklyDocs.description: URL to the LaunchDarkly documentation for this integration

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.description: URL to your organization's privacy policy

supportWebsite.title: Support Website
supportWebsite.description: URL to your integration's support website

icons.title: Icons
icons.description: Logos describing your integration in SVG format

square.title: Square logo
square.description: A square version of your integration's logo in SVG format

horizontal.title: Horizontal logo
horizontal.description: A horizontal version of your integration's logo in SVG format

requiresOAuth.title: Requires OAuth
requiresOAuth.description: Whether the integration authenticates using OAuth

hideOnIntegrationsPage.title: Hide On Integrations Page
hideOnIntegrationsPage.description: Whether the your app should be excluded from the list of integration cards displayed on our integrations page in the web app

formVariables.title: Form variables
formVariables.description: Form variables will be rendered on the integration configuration page. These are variables you need an admin to supply when they enable the integration. Examples of a form variable include `apiToken` or `url`.

items.title: Form variable
items.description: A form variable describes an object property that the LaunchDarkly admin will be prompted for when they configure an integration.

key.title: Key
key.description: A key will be used as the token name when the variable is substituted

name.title: Name
name.description: A descriptive name that will be used as the form label on the UI

description.title: Description
description.description: Describes the variable in the UI. Markdown links allowed.

placeholder.title: Description
placeholder.description: Placeholder value to use in the form element if applicable

isSecret.title: Is this variable a secret?
isSecret.description: Secret variables will be masked in the UI

isOptional.title: Is this variable optional?
isOptional.description: Variables marked as optional won't be required on the UI

isHidden.title: Hide variable in the UI
isHidden.description: Variables marked as hidden won't be displayed on the UI

defaultValue.title: Default value
defaultValue.description: Default value for variable. Can be overridden by the user in the UI

allowedValues.title: Allowed values
allowedValues.description: Allowed string values for enum-type formVariables

dynamicOptions.title: Dynamic options
dynamicOptions.description: Parser and endpoint for handling dynamicEnum

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: Properties that describe an HTTP request to an external endpoint

url.title: URL
url.description: URL to send the request to. You can use {{template markup}} to inject a formVariable into the url.

method.title: HTTP method
method.description: HTTP method to use when LaunchDarkly makes the request to your endpoint

headers.title: HTTP headers
headers.description: Headers to send with the webhook request

items.title: Header items
items.description: A name and value pair to send as headers with the hook request

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the header. Form variables can be substituted in using {{variableName}}

hmacSignature.title: HMAC signature
hmacSignature.description: Whether or not and how to configure HMAC validation on outgoing webhooks

headerName.title: HMAC signature header name
headerName.description: The name of the HMAC signature header

hmacSecretFormVariableKey.title: HMAC secret form variable key
hmacSecretFormVariableKey.description: The name of the form variable field that corresponds to the HMAC encryption secret

parser.title: Dynamic options parser
parser.description: Mapping of property names to location in JSON response

optionsPath.title: Options array path
optionsPath.description: JSON path to the array containing options for parsing

label.title: Label
label.description: Relative JSON path to values for each item in the options array to be used as UI dropdown labels

value.title: Value
value.description: Relative JSON path to values for each item in the options array to be used as dropdown values

dependsOn.title: Depends on
dependsOn.description: Dependency configuration to control the state and visibility of the form field.

variableKey.title: Variable key
variableKey.description: Key for the form variable that this form field depends on

variableLocation.title: Variable Location
variableLocation.description: Which form variable type is the variable key defined or located in?

action.title: Action
action.description: Action to be taken when your defined conditions evaluates to true

conditions.title: Conditions
conditions.description: Conditional configurations to be evaluated to decide whether an action should taken for the form field.

operator.title: Operator
operator.description: Name of the operator for evaluating a condition.

value.title: Value
value.description: Target value that conditions are evaluated against

capabilities.title: Capabilities
capabilities.description: Specify which capabilities you'd like your integration to have

auditLogEventsHook.title: Audit log events hook
auditLogEventsHook.description: This capability will enable LaunchDarkly to send audit log event webhooks to your endpoint.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: Properties that describe an HTTP request to an external endpoint

url.title: URL
url.description: URL to send the request to. You can use {{template markup}} to inject a formVariable into the url.

method.title: HTTP method
method.description: HTTP method to use when LaunchDarkly makes the request to your endpoint

headers.title: HTTP headers
headers.description: Headers to send with the webhook request

items.title: Header items
items.description: A name and value pair to send as headers with the hook request

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the header. Form variables can be substituted in using {{variableName}}

hmacSignature.title: HMAC signature
hmacSignature.description: Whether or not and how to configure HMAC validation on outgoing webhooks

headerName.title: HMAC signature header name
headerName.description: The name of the HMAC signature header

hmacSecretFormVariableKey.title: HMAC secret form variable key
hmacSecretFormVariableKey.description: The name of the form variable field that corresponds to the HMAC encryption secret

templates.title: Webhook body template
templates.description: Templates to use for body of the webhook request

flag.title: Flag template
flag.description: Template to use for flag events

project.title: Project template
project.description: Template to use for project events

environment.title: Environment template
environment.description: Template to use for environment events

default.title: default template
default.description: Template to use if the event does not have a corresponding named template

validation.title: validation template
validation.description: Template to use when sending test events with the 'validate connection' button

member.title: Member template
member.description: Template to use for member events

defaultPolicy.title: Default Policy
defaultPolicy.description: LaunchDarkly policy that allows you to filter events sent to your webhook. See https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/members/role-policies for more information.

items.title: Policy
items.description: A LaunchDarkly policy. See https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/members/role-policies for more information.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: A list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement applies. See https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/members/role-actions for more information.

effect.title: Effect
effect.description: This attribute defines whether the statement allows or denies access to the named resources and actions.

notActions.title: Not actions
notActions.description: A list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement does not apply. See https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/members/role-actions for more information.

notResources.title: Not resources
notResources.description: A list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement does not apply. See https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/members/role-resources for more information.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: A list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement applies. See https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/members/role-resources for more information.

includeErrorResponseBody.title: Include error response body
includeErrorResponseBody.description: Whether errors received from your endpoint should be displayed in the error log in LaunchDarkly UI

deliveryMethod.title: Delivery Method
deliveryMethod.description: Describes how the audit log event will be delivered to the destination. Custom delivery method indicates a custom delivery implementation in LaunchDarkly will be used.

useStandardWebhookPayload.title: Use standard webhook payload
useStandardWebhookPayload.description: Whether to send the standard audit log webhook payload or to use defined JSON templates

reservedCustomProperties.title: Reserved custom properties
reservedCustomProperties.description: This capability will reserve integration-specific custom property options in the global flag setting configuration. These custom properties will only be presented to users after they have have configured an integration subscription. Read https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/connecting/custom-properties for more information on custom properties

name.title: Name
name.description: The reserved custom property's display name.

key.title: Key
key.description: The custom property's API response key.

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.description: This capability is used to manage inbound webhook entry points that trigger feature flag changes in LaunchDarkly

documentation.title: Documentation link
documentation.description: URL to documentation describing how to configure the integration.

auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: Authentication type - currently the only option is sharedSecret.

defaultEventName.title: Default event name
defaultEventName.description: The default event name string used in the audit log if an eventName cannot be parsed in the trigger request body.

testEventNameRegexp.title: Test Event Name Regex
testEventNameRegexp.description: The expected eventName of the integration partner's test events

parser.title: Trigger parser
parser.description: Describes a mapping of property name to a location in the JSON response payload specified by a JSON pointer

eventName.title: Event name pointer
eventName.description: JSON pointer to an event name

value.title: Value pointer
value.description: JSON pointer to a metric value

url.title: URL pointer
url.description: JSON pointer to the external alert URL

approval.title: Approval
approval.description: This capability enables integration-driven flag change approvals

name.title: Approval System Name
name.description: Name of the approval system. Default's to the integration's name if not specified.

environmentFormVariables.title: Environment form variables
environmentFormVariables.description: Environment-specific form variables that render on the environment approval settings modal

operator.description: Name of the operator for evaluating a condition.

value.title: Value
value.description: Target value that conditions are evaluated against

validationRequest.title: Validation request
validationRequest.description: Details needed to make a request to test that the provided form variables are valid

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: Properties that describe an HTTP request to an external endpoint

url.title: URL
url.description: URL to send the request to. You can use {{template markup}} to inject a formVariable into the url.

method.title: HTTP method
method.description: HTTP method to use when LaunchDarkly makes the request to your endpoint

headers.title: HTTP headers
headers.description: Headers to send with the webhook request

items.title: Header items
items.description: A name and value pair to send as headers with the hook request

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the header. Form variables can be substituted in using {{variableName}}

hmacSignature.title: HMAC signature
hmacSignature.description: Whether or not and how to configure HMAC validation on outgoing webhooks

headerName.title: HMAC signature header name
headerName.description: The name of the HMAC signature header

hmacSecretFormVariableKey.title: HMAC secret form variable key
hmacSecretFormVariableKey.description: The name of the form variable field that corresponds to the HMAC encryption secret

parser.title: Feature store validation parser
parser.description: Mapping to success/errors value(s) in a JSON response body

featureStoreRequest.title: Feature store request
featureStoreRequest.description: Details needed to make a request to deliver the flag payload to the feature store

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: Properties that describe an HTTP request to an external endpoint

url.title: URL
url.description: URL to send the request to. You can use {{template markup}} to inject a formVariable into the url.

method.title: HTTP method
method.description: HTTP method to use when LaunchDarkly makes the request to your endpoint

headers.title: HTTP headers
headers.description: Headers to send with the webhook request

items.title: Header items
items.description: A name and value pair to send as headers with the hook request

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the header. Form variables can be substituted in using {{variableName}}

hmacSignature.title: HMAC signature
hmacSignature.description: Whether or not and how to configure HMAC validation on outgoing webhooks

headerName.title: HMAC signature header name
headerName.description: The name of the HMAC signature header

hmacSecretFormVariableKey.title: HMAC secret form variable key
hmacSecretFormVariableKey.description: The name of the form variable field that corresponds to the HMAC encryption secret

payloadPrefix.title: Prefix
payloadPrefix.description: Optional prefix to wrap payload data with (used for some integrations)

payloadSuffix.title: Suffix
payloadSuffix.description: Optional suffix to wrap payload data with (used for some integrations)

flagLink.title: flagLink
flagLink.description: This capability is used to manage inbound flag links

header.title: Link group header
header.description: Sentence-cased title to show for all links for this integration

emptyState.title: Empty state
emptyState.description: Content to display when there are no links to display for this integration

leadText.title: Lead text
leadText.description: Text or markup content describing how links can be created for this integration

metadata.title: FlagLink Metadata
metadata.description: Key/value pairs describing attributes for the flag link's payload metadata property. The key is the name of the metadata field and the value is the configuration object for the field.

type.title: Type
type.description: Data type for the metadata attribute

uiBlocks.title: UI Blocks
uiBlocks.description: UI blocks are visual components that represents a section of the view layout for a flag link displayed in LaunchDarkly

image.title: Image
image.description: A visual block used to render an image in LaunchDarkly UI

sourceUrl.title: Source Url
sourceUrl.description: Url of the image. Handlebars template notation can be used to reference metadata fields.

isIcon.title: Is icon
isIcon.description: Indicates whether the image should be rendered as an icon

isAvatar.title: Is avatar
isAvatar.description: Indicates whether the image should be rendered as an avatar

name.title: Name
name.description: Template string used to render a visual block in LaunchDarkly UI to display a name

title.title: Title
title.description: Object with visual elements used to display a link title in LaunchDarkly UI

elements.title: Elements
elements.description: An array of elements to be combined to create a title block

items.title: UI Block Element
items.description: A sub component of a UI block that can be combined with other elements to form a UI block

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to be displayed for the element. The text can contain template variables

isBold.title: Is bold
isBold.description: Indicates whether the element should be bolded

isTimestamp.title: Is timestamp
isTimestamp.description: Indicates whether the element should be rendered as a timestamp

url.title: Url
url.description: URL to be set for the element which also indicates the element should be rendered as a hyperlink

linkToReference.title: Link to reference
linkToReference.description: Indicates whether the title should be displayed as a hyperlink in LaunchDarkly UI

description.title: Description
description.description: Markdown string used to render a visual block in LaunchDarkly UI to display a link description

context.title: Flag Link Context
context.description: Object with visual elements used to display context information for a link in LaunchDarkly UI

elements.description: An array of elements to be combined to create a context block
elements.title: Elements

items.title: UI Block Element
items.description: A sub component of a UI block that can be combined with other elements to form a UI block

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to be displayed for the element. The text can contain template variables

isBold.title: Is bold
isBold.description: Indicates whether the element should be bolded

isTimestamp.title: Is timestamp
isTimestamp.description: Indicates whether the element should be rendered as a timestamp

url.title: Url
url.description: URL to be set for the element which also indicates the element should be rendered as a hyperlink

hideConfiguration.title: Hide Configuration
hideConfiguration.description: This capability will disable in-app editing for the integration

externalConfigurationURL.title: External Configuration URL
externalConfigurationURL.description: This capability will redirect users to an external URL when they attempt to create or edit the integration from the integrations page in LaunchDarkly.

externalConfigurationPages.title: External Configuration Pages
externalConfigurationPages.description: This capability will redirect users to an external URL when they attempt to create or edit the integration from the integrations page in LaunchDarkly. It supports different URLs for create and edit.

createUrl.title: Create URL
createUrl.description: URL to redirect to for external creation flow

editUrl.title: Edit URL
editUrl.description: URL to redirect to for external edit flow

syncedSegment.title: syncedSegment
syncedSegment.description: This capability is used to manage the creation and synchronization of synced segments

jsonResponseBody.title: Response body
jsonResponseBody.description: JSON string to be returned as a response

requestParser.title: Request parser
requestParser.description: Describes a mapping of property name to a location in the JSON request payload specified by a JSON pointer

environmentIdPath.title: Environment id path
environmentIdPath.description: JSON pointer to the LaunchDarkly environment id

contextKindPath.title: Context kind path
contextKindPath.description: JSON pointer to the LaunchDarkly context kind

cohortIdPath.title: Cohort id path
cohortIdPath.description: JSON pointer to the cohort id

cohortNamePath.title: Cohort name path
cohortNamePath.description: JSON pointer to the cohort name

cohortUrlPath.title: Cohort url path
cohortUrlPath.description: JSON pointer to the cohort URL path

memberArrayPath.title: Member array path
memberArrayPath.description: JSON pointer to the array containing members to be added or removed from the segment

addMemberArrayPath.title: Add member array path
addMemberArrayPath.description: JSON pointer to the array containing members to be added to the segment. Required if removeMemberArrayPath is specified

removeMemberArrayPath.title: Remove member array path
removeMemberArrayPath.description: JSON pointer to the array containing members to be removed to the segment. Required if addMemberArrayPath is specified

arrayInclusion.title: Array inclusion matcher
arrayInclusion.description: Describes a mapping of property name to a location in the JSON request payload indicating the action to be taken for the members in the request payload

path.title: Path
path.description: JSON pointer to the property that will be checked by the matcher property

matcher.title: Matcher
matcher.description: Regex indicating the action to be taken for the members in the segment. If it matches the value of path property, the members of the incoming segment will be added otherwise they will be removed

memberArrayParser.title: Member array parser
memberArrayParser.description: Describes a mapping of property name to a location in the member array JSON payload specified by a JSON pointer. All paths are relative to the member array path

memberIdPath.title: Member id path
memberIdPath.description: JSON pointer to the member id

booleanMembershipPath.title: Boolean membership path
booleanMembershipPath.description: JSON pointer to the property in member array payload indicating whether the member should be added or removed

cohortNamePath.title: Cohort name path
cohortNamePath.description: JSON pointer to the cohort name. Overrides the cohort name for a single member

cohortIdPath.title: Cohort id path
cohortIdPath.description: JSON pointer to the cohort id. Overrides the cohort id for a single member

bigSegmentStore.title: Big segment store
bigSegmentStore.description: This capability allows LaunchDarkly to sync big segment data directly to a user-managed database

dbStyle.title: Database style
dbStyle.description: Describes what type of database LaunchDarkly will sync big segments to

flagImport.title: Flag Import
flagImport.description: This capability enables importing feature flags to LaunchDarkly

templates.title: Flag import body template
templates.description: Templates to use for parsing of the flag import body

splitOverview.title: Split template
splitOverview.description: Template to use for imports from Split

splitDetails.title: Split Details template
splitDetails.description: Template to use for imports from Split

statsig.title: StatSig template
statsig.description: Template to use for imports from StatSig

includeErrorResponseBody.title: Include error response body
includeErrorResponseBody.description: Whether errors received while importing should be displayed in the error log in LaunchDarkly UI

oauthIntegrationKey.title: OAuth Integration Key
oauthIntegrationKey.description: Unique key to be used to save and retrieve OAuth credentials used by your app. This is required if your app uses an OAuth flow.

allowIntegrationConfigurations.title: Allow Integration Configurations
allowIntegrationConfigurations.description: Whether the integration allows integration configurations. Will apply to all capabilities on the manifest.
